articles.title: Sports contest for Mangyongdae Cup opens
articles.content:
Sports contest for Mangyongdae Cup opens 
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The sports contest for Mangyongdae Cup has opened on the occasion of President Kim Il Sung's birth anniversary.
 During the period, games of over 50 events will take place in Pyongyang, North Hwanghae Province, South Phyongan Province, South Hamgyong Province, Nampho and other places.   
 The opening ceremony was held in Sariwon yesterday.

New chairman of Hanchongryon elected
articles.content:
New chairman of Hanchongryon elected 
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon) on Apr. 6 held a meeting of its deputies and elected its new chairman at Hongik University despite police total blockade, according to Seoul-based Yonhap News.
 Choe Sung Hwan, chairman of the general students council of Pusan National University, was elected chairman of the 9th-term Hanchongryon.    
 It is said that more than 3,500 policemen were deployed around the university on the day.

Yang Hyong Sop meets delegation of Pugwash conference
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop meets delegation of Pugwash conference 
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and conversed with a delegation of the Pugwash conference on science and world affair headed by emeritus President Joseph Rotblat in a friendly atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there was Ri Song Ho, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is also vice-chairman of the Korean National Peace Committee.    
 At the meeting the emeritus president said that it is abnormal that the Korean people who had lived in harmony as a homogeneous nation are suffering from divison for more than half a century and that Korea should be reunified by the concerted efforts of the north and south of Korea without outsiders' interference.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam meets Swiss guests
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam meets Swiss guests
    Pyongyang, April 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today met and conversed with Franz Von Daeniken, secretary of state of the federal department of foreign affairs of Switzerland and his party who paid a courtesy call on him, in a friendly atmosphere at the Mansudae Assembly Hall. 
 Saying the Swiss people have feelings of friendship with the Korean people, the secretary expressed the belief that the Swiss government would continue to support positive changes in the Korean peninsula.    
 Foreign minister Paek Nam Sun also met and conversed with the secretary and his party, who paid a courtesy call on him, in a friendly atmosphere.
